ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Health Education and Development Society (HEADS), which contains the detailed picture of the services rendered, activities implemented for the welfare and development of the weaker section of society. It is well aware that HEADS was promoted by some of our youth team members emerged from rural settings and started as a service organization with the mission of â€œEmpowering Oppressed Community through Education, Awareness and Participation on Development Servicesâ€. It was started in the year 1991 and got registered under Tamil Nadu Societies Registration Act 1975. Being started as a small local organization providing voluntary services in 5 villages in and around Nallur village in Kulithalai Block in Karur District, at present it is working in 45 villages in Kulithalai, Thogamalai, Krishnarayapuram and Aravakurichi Blocks in Karur District. There are 40 staff members in the Field and Administration in addition to 45 Volunteers. During the year 2004-2005, HEADS has implemented various schemes and programmes as institutional as well as non-institutional services for the socially disadvantaged groups such as women in distress living in poor and difficult circumstances, children, adolescents and youth and old age persons in the target area. ïƒ˜ Integrated special homes for destitute Children and Aged people shelter ïƒ˜ Family Counseling Centre, ïƒ˜ Short Stay Home, ïƒ˜ Rajiv Gandhi National Creche programme ïƒ˜ Old Age Person, PLHA programme, ïƒ˜ Micro level programmes ïƒ˜ Awareness Programmes on Women Empowerment programmes, ïƒ˜ EDP programmes, Vocational Training , ïƒ˜ South Indian AIDS Action programme HIV/AIDS MSM intervention programme, , ïƒ˜ R.T.E agricultural entrepreneurship training and celebration of important world national days. Our special focus of actives during this years has been on HIV/AIDS affected women and children who have been toiling for livelihood and educational training in the society. This year HEADS has conducted shortly on his own strength capacity and its future by inviting From2013 to 2014. The shortly helped the Director, Staff Members, Volunteers, Members of Governing body and the Target People to realize this strength and capacity and the direction in which HEADS has to grow to achieve this goals. Vocational skills on the following trades were organized for the SHG women members during this year for their economic empowerment: â€¢ Food Processing-Juice and Jam Making â€¢ Pickles/Pappadam Making â€¢ Grocery Condiments Preparation â€¢ Milk and Milk Products â€¢ Basket Making â€¢ Fur Toy Making â€¢ Pearls Garlands Making â€¢ Woolen Mat Making â€¢ Goat/Sheep/Rabbit Rearing â€¢ Candle/Camphor/Incense Cake and Stick Making The above skill trainings are three days orientation camps in which the group members were imparted demonstration of practical work of making such goods. In the above six trades, 270 SHG members were trained at 30 members for each trade While thanking the Sponsors, Donors, Government Officials, Well Wishers, Community Members, Volunteers, Staff Team and the Executive Committee Members for their cooperation and coordination in implementing our programmes and extending our committed services to the oppressed communities, we are happy to propose our near future programmes planned for implementation for the benefits of the community. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: ICCW,TN started in 1953 works for child survival, development, protection and participation with a holistic approach of strengthening families and communities. There is branch in every District of Tamil Nadu with the Collector as President and a Committee of Official and non Official Members. Programmes include Prevention of Female Infanticide and empowerement of women and girls in Madurai District. Achievement- From 200 infanticides recorded in 1988 to nil in 2001. Programmes for prevention and rehabilitation of Child Labour in match and beedi industry in Virudhunagar and Vellore Districts. Achievement- Stoppage of bonded labour system in Beedi industry. Now Phase II of projects focusing on vocational training through educational sponsorship(Vellore) and Community College ( Srivilliputhur). Programmes for Child Protection: Crisis Intervention Centre for prevention, rescue, rehabilitation and after care of child abuse and neglect Childline 1098 a 24 hour toll free number for children in distress at Chennai (South)and Cuddalore. Project for identification and rehabilitation of Child Beggars at Chennai Training of Multidisciplinary professionals to respond to child abuse cases Training of Watchdog Committees in Panchayats for prevention of trafficking of children Established a Network of NGOs in 32 Districts of Tamil Nadu for Child Protection. Workshops for Stakeholders on Child Protection in all districts of Tamil Nadu with Government appropriate authorities and NGOs Workshops for children on Child Rights and Protection in all Districts and State Level. Residential Institutions for children at Chennai, Thiruvallur and Thanjavur Districts for destitute and hearing impaired children. Community Based services: Creches for children of working women â€“ 147 (2009) in the State. Financial Sponsorship Support to families for care and education of children to prevent child labour or Institutionalisation. Counselling and Guidance for Special Needs children. ICCW,TN provides psychological and financial assistance for physically and mentally challenged children and their families. Services include awareness, identification of disabilities, referral and counselling services. Training:- Training of Child Care Workers is a core activity of ICCW,TN. Training of Balasevikas, Anganwadi workers, etc has been done since 1962. The Training of Supervisors for ICDS Programme through out Tamil Nadu is done by ICCWTN since 1985. Short Term Training Workshops for Teachers, Creche Workers and others are conducted on various child related issues â€“ Preschool Education, Nutrition, Child Protection etc. Community Colleges at Chennai and Srivilliputhur have been started to offer Job oriented Training such as Computer Hardware, Child care, Fashion Designing, etc to disadvantaged Youth. Adoption Services â€“ ICCWTN acts as a consultant to the Courts in Tamil Nadu who forward applications for Adoption of a child, whether In country or Inter country, for scrutiny and comments by the Council. The Information, Documentation and Research Centre of the Council undertakes various studies on child centred issues which include An analysis of the State Budget and Expenditure on Children 1998 -2004, A study of children placed in Indian Adoption, etc. It also documents and publishes reference books such as â€œChild and Law in Indiaâ€ a compilation of all laws concerning children, a Directory of Child Welfare Institutions in Tamil Nadu.

ngoList.title: INDIAN TRIATHLON FEDERATION
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Indian Triathlon Federation is a National Sports Federation formed to oversee the promotion and development of the sport Triathlon in India. The Federation was formed in 1990 and registered under the Tamil Nadu Societies Registration Act 1975 Tamil Nadu Act 27 of 1975. ITF headquarters is in Chennai having their office at Khivraj Complex II, 2nd Floor, 480, Anna Salai, Nandanam, Chennai 600 035. ITF has 26 State Associations & affiliated units and 4 Associate Members who are actively involved in the promotion and development of the game in India. The Federation is affiliated to Indian Olympic Association, Asian Triathlon Confederation and also with the International Triathlon Union. Indian Triathlon Federation conducts various activities during the year: Coaching Camps, Tournaments National & International, Daily training at The Indian Triathlon Academy, Chennai, Coaches Clinic, Participates in international competitions, Technical Official Course, Community Course. Triathlon is a combination of swimming, cycling, running. In its purest form, events start with a swim, is then followed by a bicycle ride, and completed with a run, all over a stipulated distance. Major activities and achievements of ITF in 2015-16: The 12th South Asian Games were held in Guwahati & Shillong from 5th to 16th February 2016 and the triathlon events were held on 13th & 14th February 2016. The Countries took part in this event include India, Nepal and Sri Lanka. In both the Men- Individual & Women-Individual category, India bagged the Gold & Silver medal and in the Mix-Relay category, Indian team bagged the Gold. To enhance the athleteâ€™s development from the South Asian Region and increase the participants in the South Asian Games, the ASTC-ITU Development Camp was held from 6th â€“ 11th February 2016 at Guwahati, India. 16 athletes from three difference counties including India, Nepal and Sri Lanka joined the training camp. ITU and ASTC hosted the ITU Level 1 Technical Official seminar at Guwahati, India from 10th â€“ 11th February 2016. Twenty eight participants from India and Nepal took part in the two days seminar to upgrade their knowledge and know-how on officiating at the international events and learn more about interpreting and applying ITU competition rules from Ms. Rachel Ribo, ITU Facilitator from Philippines.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: We obtained for developing rural development model to ensure food security for poor women mostly widows. we also conducted training and awareness program for women empowerment among other development organisations and academic institutions.We promoted knowledge and personality development base activities through educational methodologies. we created knowledge on policy formation and contributed to government policies. we organised interactive meetings with officials to highlight schemes.

We developed viable and sustainable livelihood models for rural poor. We developed training modules to enhance knowledge and skill among the rural people. Safe cultivation methods are taught with low cost manures. We taught kitchen garden development and grow multi-crop in small available place. We conducted awareness programs among women on small entrepreneurial activities. We created awareness on the importance of indigenous cows and benefits. We ensured household food security and nutrition

We organised Rural development programs on food security and nutrition based. Formed women groups and involved them on food grain and vegetable production related activities. kitchen garden development and viable utility of small place. Taught the importance of cattle especially the indigenous cow. Created awareness on government schemes and development of possible schemes. our approach is solution oriented to any given problem. Education and training modules are our strength. Training to NGOs

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Major Activities/Achievements:1.Enforcement of Human Rights: Community Education for Awareness on Human Rights,Social Justice,and Dalit Liberation Uniting Dalits to prepare them to meet their own needs-Self Defence. Training Dalit Young men and women and guiding Dalits in availing Welfare Schemes of the state and central government.Advocacy on community needs and services such as drinking water,streets lights, and road facilities2.Enforcement of Women:Women Groups Formation(SHGs)Savings and Micro Enterprises Skill and capasity building for women empower themselves,Education and accessing women health needs on reproductive health,Formation of Federation of the SHGs formed at the Panchayat Level,Block level and District level.3.Protection of Child Rights and Promotion of Child Welfare:Non Formal Education to persuade children to continue schools and hygienic behaviour and practices.Child care services through care takers.Healthy and Hygienic environment activities for the children.4HIV/AIDS Preventive Education:Preventive Education among the Industrial Workers and Female Sex Workers,Home based care services,Free supply of Uniform,Free Books and Educational Materials to the Positive Childrens.5.Anti-Trafficking Initiative:Identification of the Girls subject to trafficking by investigating the people from high risk group,Rescue of the girls with the help of the police,Rehabilitation of Trafficking girls till they reach their parents/care tackers.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Main thrust area of the organization is social, education, economical development of neglected women and children of Depressed most backward communities and minorities through organizing the women into groups and federation; provided varies, training, exposure and workshops on leadership, decision-making, free legal aid, PRIs strengthening Skill Training on Tailoring, Palm Leaf Making and Areca Plates and improving the women involvement in the process of PRIs at all levels, gender, political s.

Target Intervention Education Program on HIV/AIDS among the Female Sex Workers in Sivakasi,Srivilliputhur, Vembakottai Rajapalayam and Watrab of Virudhunagar District, covered 910 Female sex workers, Training on One to one, one two groups, Counselling ,Usages of condoms, HIV Test, care and support and health care programs are conducted .

Brief Background of Project: Prevention Education among the School Youths on STDs/HIV/AIDS: The persons in the age group of 13 to 16 are mostly vulnerable to HIV and AIDS. Educating people about HIV/AIDS and how it can be prevented is complicated in India, due to number of factors like poverty, lack of information and communication awareness in people, religious mythology, socio-economic status etc. To create awareness among the peer group, above 14 years, students of Standard IX, X and XII

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Inspire has trained reviving earth techniques to 12 Lakh Farmers across India. Revived Tsunami Hit Farming Lands of 25000 Acres through organic techniques. Then President Shri. Abdul Kalam visited the lands for viewing the reclamation activities. Upon invitation from Mr. Bill Clinton , Former President of the United States, Inspires team visited Indonesia and Sri Lanka to revive saline land. Restored 385 traditional paddy varieties for needy farmers. Trained farmers upon invitation from govmt.
